title: Volume of a solid with known cross-section

content.question: Let R be the region in the first quadrant bounded above by the graph of <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>ln</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math>, for <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </math>. R is the base of a solid for which each cross section perpendicular to the x-axis is a square. What is the volume of the solid?

topic.text: 8.7: Volumes with Cross Sections - Squares and Rectangles

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
